business.headline: RCB to get new owner? Diageo looking for stake sale, says reportDiageo Plc, the British company that owns RCB through its Indian arm United Spirits Ltd., is exploring options to sell a part or all of its stake in the franchise.

Planning to pay 0 tax by setting up in Dubai? Coinswitch co-founder calls it a trapStarting a company in Dubai sounds appealing with no income tax and easy formalities. But if you operate from India, authorities might still consider it an Indian firm. Here's why.

Lilavati Trust hits back at HDFC Bank, rejects outstanding duesIn a sharply worded statement issued Monday, the Trust asserted that neither it nor its permanent trustee Prashant Kishor Mehta has ever borrowed from HDFC Bank.

Paras Defence shares in focus today, rise over 1% in early trade. Here's whyAlongside the 1:2 stock split, Paras Defence also declared its first-ever dividend of Rs 0.50 per share during its Q4 FY25 earnings on April 30. The announcement came on the back of a strong financial performance for the quarter.

Bengaluru's PG crisis: What's behind the mass shutdowns?Once the lifeline for Bengaluru's migrant workforce, why are PGs now vanishing from the city's tech hubs at an alarming pace? Read on know why hundreds of PG accommodations have shut down in the city.
Sensex, Nifty extend gains at open but lose steam as profit booking sets inThe S&P BSE Sensex added 68.34 points to 82,513.55, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 19.40 points to 25,128.05 as of 9:25 am.
Hiring plans steady in India Inc for Q3 FY25: ReportIndia ranked second globally, behind the UAE, which reported the strongest hiring sentiment. India reported a Net Employment Outlook (NEO) of 42%.

Stock market opening today: Sensex, Nifty likely to open higher. Here's whyThe Sensex and Nifty are likely to extend their gains, helped by improving hopes around global trade discussions and the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) policy measures.

Stocks to watch on June 10: Wipro, Tech Mahindra, Motilal Oswal, Premier EnergiesSensex and Nifty rose nearly half a percent in the last session, driven by favourable trends in both domestic and global markets.

Rs 33,000 per device, Rs 3,000 monthly post-trial: Starlink's India entry planStarlink customers will need to purchase a satellite dish-essential hardware for accessing the service-at an estimated cost of Rs 33,000. The monthly unlimited data plan will be offered at Rs 3,000.

Warner Bros Discovery to become two separate companies: ReportThe decision comes as more people stop watching traditional TV and move to streaming platforms. This shift has forced many media companies to rethink how they work.

Your Rs 1 crore flat is now Rs 90 lakh: Investor explains why value is shrinkingA financial influencer warns that unchecked money printing and currency devaluation could be reducing the real value of properties and other assets, urging investments in inflation-resistant assets.

Pakistan's economy set to grow 2.7% in FY25: ReportPakistan's central bank, in a bid to encourage growth, cut its policy rate by more than 1,000 basis points in the current fiscal year. Its latest cut last month brought the key rate to 11%, resuming an easing cycle that had brought rates down from 22% after a brief pause in March.
Sensex settles over 200 points; Nifty above 25,100; Kotak Bank gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 256.22 points to close at 82,445.21, while the NSE Nifty50 added 100.20 points to end at 25,103.20.

Who is Sashidhar Jagdishan? HDFC Bank CEO under financial fraud lensSashidhar Jagdishan has been a part of HDFC Bank since 1996. He joined as a manager in the finance division and quickly rose through the ranks.

Shein, Reliance aim to sell India-made clothes globally within a year: ReportThe aim is to make Shein-branded clothes in India not just for local sales but also for international markets, starting with the US and UK, within the next 6 to 12 months.
Gautam Adani earned Rs 10.41 crore in FY25: Who earned more than him?Gautam Adani earned Rs 10.41 crore in the financial year 2024–25, which is much less than several leading business heads in India.

RBI's bumper rate cut leaves rupee exposed to fresh depreciation riskThe rupee has already lagged behind its Asian peers in 2025, weighed down by tepid capital inflows. Now, with the RBI easing faster than the US Federal Reserve, the narrowing interest rate differential is expected to keep the rupee on the back foot.

HDFC Bank and BoB cut lending rates after RBI repo rate slashBorrowers can expect EMIs on home loans, personal loans, and other credit products to come down slightly, offering a bit of breathing space amid rising living costs.

Income Tax ramps up checks on big transactions with new filing and TDS rulesThe Income Tax Department has ramped up efforts to spot individuals who spend heavily but may be hiding their real income, using data analytics and tighter links with financial institutions.
Currency devaluation is quietly eating into your wealth, expert warnsYour money or assets might look the same in your account, but its real value could be slipping away every year, warns expert.

India's $80 billion coal-power boom is running short of water: ReportThirty-seven of the 44 new projects named in the undated power ministry shortlist of future operations are located in areas that the government classifies as either suffering from water scarcity or stress.

World's largest container ship MSC IRINA docks at Vizhinjam SeaportMSC IRINA's docking at Vizhinjam International Seaport signals growing confidence in the port's readiness to handle Ultra-Large Container Vessels (ULCVs).
Sensex opens 382 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; Axis Bank gains over 1%The S&P BSE Sensex added 335.02 points to 82,524.01, while the NSE Nifty50 added 114.85 points to 25,117.90 as of 9:28 am.

Stock market opening: Will Sensex, Nifty continue market rally today?As per Gift Nifty futures, the Nifty50 is expected to open above Friday's close of 25,003.05. The futures were trading at 25,182 around 8:35 am, suggesting a stronger start to the new trading session.

Stocks to watch on June 9: HDFC Bank, Infosys, Airtel, Tata Steel, MCX, BELThe policy announcements by the RBI improved market sentiment and pushed indices higher. As trading begins on Monday, investors will be looking at some key companies and developments that may impact share prices.

QuBeats bags Rs 25 crore defence grant to build quantum navigation for Indian NavyThe startup will use the money to build a Quantum Positioning System (QPS) for the Indian Navy. This system will help naval ships and submarines navigate even in places where GPS does not work.

RBI rate cut lights up Dalal Street, but will the rally continue?The RBI reduced the repo rate to 5.5% and also changed its policy stance from 'accommodative' to 'neutral', suggesting that it will now wait and watch before making further moves.

India's poverty rate sees sharp decline, falls to 5.3% in 2022-23India's updated consumption data helped offset the World Bank's revised International Poverty Line, reducing the global increase in extreme poverty by 125 million people.

Elon Musk's Starlink gets licence from telecom ministryElon Musk's Starlink has received a crucial licence from India's telecom ministry, paving the way for its satellite internet services in the country.
Elon Musk's Starlink gets licence to launch in India: ReportStarlink had applied for the licence back in 2022, but the process was delayed due to various concerns, including national security.

Sensex jumps over 700 points, Nifty goes past 25,000; Bajaj Finance gains 5%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 746.95 points to end at 82,188.99, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 252.15 points to close at 25,003.05.

US doubles steel, aluminium tariff: Is it a big worry for India?The tariff hike does not apply to all countries. The United Kingdom has been excluded because of a trade agreement already in place with the US.
RBI rate cut may hurt FDs. Here's what investors should do nowBanks have already begun adjusting their FD rates downward following the RBI's earlier moves since February 2025.

Elon Musk thought he could play politics. Now Tesla's paying the priceElon Musk's fallout with Donald Trump cost Tesla $150 billion in a day. His gamble with power seems to be backfiring fast, and the fallout could reach far beyond the stock market.

Explained: What does the RBI mean by front-loading the rate cutThe RBI's latest rate cut is being called a "front-loaded" rate cut, meaning the central bank is cutting interest rates earlier and by a bigger margin than usual.

RBI's big CRR boost: What it means for banks and youIf you're eyeing a home loan, car loan, or personal loan, this development could work in your favour. With banks gaining access to more funds, interest rates on loans are likely to drop, which means your monthly EMIs could reduce.

RBI cuts repo rate again: 5 key takeaways you must knowSince February 2025, the RBI has slashed the repo rate by a full 100 basis points. With this sharp reduction, it believes there's now less room left to cut rates further to support growth. So, the RBI has changed its policy stance from "accommodative" to "neutral".

RBI slashes repo rate by 50 basis points to 5.5%, third consecutive cutThe Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has reduced the repo rate by 50 basis points to 5.5%, marking the third consecutive rate cut. This decision comes amid a sharp drop in retail inflation to 3.16% in April and strong economic growth of 7.4% in the January-March quarter. The move is expected to make loans cheaper, benefiting borrowers, especially home buyers. The RBI has also changed its stance from accommodative to neutral, indicating a data-driven approach moving forward.

Sensex jumps 700 points: Why RBI's bumper rate cut has Dalal Street buzzingStock market today: The S&P BSE Sensex was up by 731.61 points to 82,173.65, while the NSE Nifty rallied by 236.30 points to 24,987.20 as of 11:21 am.

entertainment.headline: Vivek Agnihotri renames The Delhi Files to The Bengal Files on public demandFilmmaker Vivek Agnihotri has announced a new title for his upcoming political drama, earlier called 'The Delhi Files'. The filmmaker has changed the name to 'The Bengali Files' due to public demand.

Maldives names Katrina Kaif as global tourism ambassador ahead of PM Modi's visitActor Katrina Kaif was announced as the global tourism ambassador for the Maldives on Tuesday. The development comes a month before PM Modi's scheduled visit to the island country.

Ram Charan, wife Upasana celebrate newlyweds Akhil Akkineni, Zainab with new picsRam Charan and his wife Upasana Kamineni wished newlyweds Akhil Akkineni and Zainab Ravdjee. She shared new pictures from their intimate wedding and reception.

Deepika Padukone announces badminton school in birthday post for father PrakashDeepika Padukone dedicated a beautiful note to her father and legendary badminton player, Prakash Padukone, as she announced the launch of the 'Padukone School of Badminton' on his 70th birthday.

Gurdas Maan's brother Gurpanth dies at 68 in Mohali, last rites to be held todayPunjabi singer-turned-actor Gurdas Maan's younger brother reportedly died in Mohali on Monday. His last rites will be held today (June 10) in Chandigarh.

Neha Dhupia backs Deepika's 8-hour shift call, says new moms need practical supportActor Neha Dhupia wrote a note on social media, supporting Deepika Padukone's reported demand for an eight-hour work shift. She tagged Padukone on her Instagram stories, telling all that new mothers don't just require lip service.

Housefull 5 box office Day 4: Fastest film in franchise to enter Rs 100 crore clubAkshay Kumar's 'Housefull 5' surpassed the Rs 100 crore-mark in India after five days of theatrical run. The film witnessed a drop on Monday, but nothing that wasn't expected or could play a deterrent in its longer run.

Amanda Seyfried accuses Paramount of owing her money for Mean Girls merchandiseActor Amanda Seyfried has revealed that she has not received royalties from Paramount Pictures for 'Mean Girls' merchandise featuring her image. The issue extends to other cast members, raising concerns about unpaid earnings from the popular 2004 teen film.

How Kamal Haasan's Thug Life failed its women: Trisha, Abhirami, Aishwarya LekshmiDirector Mani Ratnam's 'Thug Life', starring Kamal Haasan and Silambarasan, has been receiving mixed reviews from critics and audiences. However, the biggest injustice was meted out to the women in the film, played by Trisha Krishnan, Abhirami and Aishwarya Lekshmi.

BTS are back: What to expect from the return of Kings of K-popBTS members have started returning from military service, marking the end of a long hiatus and sparking excitement across the K-pop world. HYBE shares have surged as fans and investors anticipate a major comeback and global tour.

Thug Life box office Day 5: Is Kamal Haasan's film heading towards a disaster?Kamal Haasan and director Mani Ratnam's 'Thug Life' is struggling to strike big at the box office. The film recorded its lowest Monday collection ever.

BTS' RM and V complete military service, promise album and concerts 'real soon'BTS members RM and V are now back after serving their mandatory military service. They expressed their desire to return to the stage after releasing an album 'real soon.'

New faces join Harry Potter HBO series: Meet the Malfoys, Dursleys, and moreHBO reveals nine new cast members for its upcoming Harry Potter TV series, promising a faithful adaptation of The Sorcerer's Stone. The series will stream exclusively on Max in multiple countries.

Sly Stone, groundbreaking musician behind 'Family Affair,' dies in Los AngelesSly Stone, iconic frontman of Sly and the Family Stone, died at 82. Known for revolutionizing funk and promoting unity through music, his influence shaped decades of American sound and culture.

Diddy's ex-girlfriend recounts trauma in wake of Cassie's abuse claimsDiddy's ex-girlfriend broke down in court, saying Cassie's abuse lawsuit mirrored her own trauma. She testified about coerced sex, emotional abuse, and threats linked to her housing and relationship with Combs.

Judge dismisses Justin Baldoni's $400 million defamation lawsuit against Blake LivelyA US judge dismissed Justin Baldoni's $650 million lawsuits against Blake Lively, Ryan Reynolds, and others, ruling insufficient evidence of defamation. A separate trial between Baldoni and Lively begins in 2026.

Frederick Forsyth, author of 'The Day of the Jackal, dies at 86Frederick Forsyth, bestselling author of The Day of the Jackal, died at 86. A former RAF pilot and journalist, he secretly aided MI6 and leaves behind a legacy of iconic thrillers.

Akhanda 2 teaser out: Nandamuri Balakrishna's action saga set for September releaseDirected by Boyapati Sreenu, the sequel to the 2021 Telugu blockbuster film 'Akhanda' stars Nandamuri Balakrishna in the lead. Titled 'Akhanda 2: Thaandavam', the film also stars Samyuktha Menon and Aadhi Pinisetty in prominent roles.

Ed Sheeran praises Arijit Singh's Tum Hi Ho in heartfelt post: I was spellboundEnglish singer-songwriter Ed Sheeran recently shared a heartwarming note dedicated to Arijit Singh. Apart from cherishing his experience of scooter rides with Arjit, Ed also praised 'Tum Hi Ho' from 'Aashiqui 2'.

general news.headline: Don't like husband getting intimate, Indore woman texted lover days before murderMeghalaya murder case: Sonam Raghuvanshi, accused of killing her husband Raja Raghuvanshi on their honeymoon in Meghalaya, told her lover she did not like her husband being intimate with her, sources told India Today TV.

Chief Minister planned RCB event, invited Governor: Raj Bhavan on stampede rowKarnataka Raj Bhavan sources claim the state government invited the Governor to the Vidhana Soudha felicitation for RCB. This contradicts Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's claim that the event wasn't government-organised.

3 killed in Delhi apartment fire as father, two children jump off 7th floorThe fire has been reported from the top floor of the multi-storied apartment building. Eight fire engines have been rushed to the spot.

700 US Marines land in LA as California sues Trump over guard deploymentAs the protests enter their fourth day, the deployment of 700 marines in Los Angeles, described as temporary, is intended to support National Guard forces already on the ground. Meanwhile, California has sued the Trump administration, calling the federal deployment unlawful.

Deepika Padukone announces badminton school in birthday post for father PrakashDeepika Padukone dedicated a beautiful note to her father and legendary badminton player, Prakash Padukone, as she announced the launch of the 'Padukone School of Badminton' on his 70th birthday.

Bengaluru's PG crisis: What's behind the mass shutdowns?Once the lifeline for Bengaluru's migrant workforce, why are PGs now vanishing from the city's tech hubs at an alarming pace? Read on know why hundreds of PG accommodations have shut down in the city.

Why One Nation, One Election might have to wait till 2034The One Nation, One Election initiative will not be implemented before 2034, reiterated BJP MP PP Chaudhary, who is heading the Joint Parliamentary Committee on the proposed Bill. The delay is due to several complex constitutional changes, logistical challenges, and the need for extensive political consensus that the Chaudhary-led panel is working on.

13-year-old girl sexually assaulted, leg broken inside Chennai government shelterA 13-year-old girl was sexually assaulted and left with a broken leg inside a government-run shelter in Chennai. The accused, a long-time security guard at the facility, was arrested after the survivor identified him.

How Kamal Haasan's Thug Life failed its women: Trisha, Abhirami, Aishwarya LekshmiDirector Mani Ratnam's 'Thug Life', starring Kamal Haasan and Silambarasan, has been receiving mixed reviews from critics and audiences. However, the biggest injustice was meted out to the women in the film, played by Trisha Krishnan, Abhirami and Aishwarya Lekshmi.

Karnataka High Court's nine big questions to state in Bengaluru stampede caseThe Karnataka High Court sharply criticised the state government while hearing petitions in the Bengaluru stampede case. It questioned procedural lapses, sought accountability and demanded answers to nine key queries regarding crowd management, permissions and emergency preparedness.

Video: Fire, explosions continue on cargo ship off Kerala coast, firefighting onA major fire and explosions aboard the Singapore-flagged container ship MV Wan Hai 503 off the Kerala coast triggered ongoing firefighting and salvage operations.

RCB to get new owner? Diageo looking for stake sale, says reportDiageo Plc, the British company that owns RCB through its Indian arm United Spirits Ltd., is exploring options to sell a part or all of its stake in the franchise.

Important to keep on telling stories: Journalist after being shot at LA protestAn Australian reporter hit by a rubber bullet during immigration raid protests in Los Angeles, US, shared a powerful message after the incident.

Maldives names Katrina Kaif as global tourism ambassador ahead of PM Modi's visitActor Katrina Kaif was announced as the global tourism ambassador for the Maldives on Tuesday. The development comes a month before PM Modi's scheduled visit to the island country.

How to download and install iOS 26 with Apple's stunning new design on iPhoneApple has officially rolled out the first developer version of iOS 26 just hours after it was announced at WWDC 2025. Here is how to download and install the latest iOS 26 version, which brings Apple's stunning new liquid glass design to your iPhone today.

Made a scapegoat, suspended Bengaluru cop alleges in plea to tribunalSuspended Bengaluru police officer in his petition challenging the government order for his removal stated that he is being scapegoated for the Chinnaswamy Stadium stampede. In his plea to the Central Administrative Tribunal, he alleges the suspension was arbitrary and driven by public pressure.

Amid riots, JD Vance's meme threat to deport fashion critic who hates his suitsAmid Los Angeles immigration raids, US fashion influencer Derek Guy revealed he is undocumented, prompting Vice President JD Vance to respond with a meme which many saw as a thinly veiled deportation threat.

Video: Indore woman's lover attended her husband's funeral, seen consoling fatherAccording to eyewitnesses, Raj had brought along several people with him to Raja's funeral. On June 2, Raja's body was discovered inside a gorge by the Meghalaya Police. Soon after, his body was brought to his hometown, Indore, for funeral.

6 earthquakes rattle India-Myanmar border in last 36 hoursSix earthquakes with mild to moderate intensity were felt at the India-Myanmar border in the last nearly 36 hours. The last tremor was recorded at 11.21 am with a magnitude of 4.3 and was felt near Manipur.
Space Station is ready as arrival of Indian astronaut gets delayedThe Ax-4 mission with astronauts from India, the US, Poland and Hungary has been postponed by 24 hours and will launch on June 11.

Blinkit worker's post reveals the blood, sweat and chaos behind 10-minute deliveryWhile customers enjoy lightning-fast service, the Blinkit worker revealed a workplace culture marked by physical strain, mental burnout, and unsafe conditions.

Can't kill, cops lying: Mother defends jailed son in Meghalaya honeymoon murderThe mother of Raj Kushwaha, accused in the murder of Indore businessman Raja Raghuvanshi in Meghalaya, has denied police claims, alleging false charges against her son.

Why no formal complaint? Poll body pulls up Rahul Gandhi over rigging remarksAccording to Election Commission sources, despite Rahul Gandhi's public statements alleging irregularities or raising concerns, no formal complaint or request for a meeting has been submitted by him, even two days after the remarks.

Car hangs mid-air from unfinished flyover in UP, occupants escape unhurtA car heading from Nepal towards Gorakhpur ended up hanging mid-air from the edge of an under-construction flyover on National Highway 24 in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj district. Google Maps show no indication of a flyover at the site where the incident happened.

sports.headline: World Test Championship final key to Australia's quest for greatness: Nathan LyonNathan Lyon emphasises the importance of the World Test Championship final for Australia's cricketing journey to becoming one of the greatest Test sides of all time. The Aussies aim to retain their crown while facing a tough South African side at Lord's.

MS Dhoni's hands are faster than a pickpocket: Ravi Shastri leaves crowd in splitsFormer India cricketer and head coach Ravi Shastri compared MS Dhoni's quick glovework as a wicketkeeper with a pickpocket. Dhoni has been included in the prestigious ICC Hall of Fame becoming the 11th player to achieve the honour.

Argentina can play the same way with or without Lionel Messi: Lionel ScaloniArgentina manager Lionel Scaloni says the team can play similarly whether Lionel Messi is in the squad or not. Argentina are all set to play Colombia in their World Cup Qualifier match in Buenos Aires on June 10

Pat Cummins missing India in the WTC final: Always expect them to be aroundAustralia captain Pat Cummins said that it was nice to face another opposition apart from India in the World Test Championship (WTC) final as they always make it to the finals.

Formula 1 reveals 2026 calendar, Madrid's debut date revealed in 24-race seasonFormula One and the FIA released the full schedule for the 2026 season as the new car regulations will come into place. The debut date for the Madrid Grand Prix was also revealed on Tuesday, April 10.

Churros, cool breeze and warm sun: Arshdeep Singh happy to be back in 2nd home KentArshdeep Singh returns to Kent, his second home, to prepare for the upcoming India-England Test series. His focus is on regaining red-ball rhythm and improving skills alongside star pacer Jasprit Bumrah.

Watch: Rishabh Pant breaks stadium's roof with monstrous six during practiceIndia wicketkeeper batter Rishabh Pant damaged the stadium's roof during a practice session ahead of the five-match Test series against England set to begin from June 20.

KL Rahul A+, Yashasvi Jaiswal D: Report card of Indian stars in India A vs England LionsThe Indian stars got some good time in the middle during the India A vs England Lions series ahead of the start of the Test tour. While some impressed, others failed to make a mark as India get set for the first Test against England, starting on June 20.

MS Dhoni's priceless reaction after being inducted in ICC Hall of FameLegendary India captain MS Dhoni was inducted into the ICC Hall of Fame amongst six other players. Dhoni said that it was a huge honour to join a club full of legends, and he will cherish it forever.

Hayden, Graeme Smith, Hashim Amla among others inducted in ICC Hall of FameThe International Cricket Council (ICC) announced seven new inductees into the Hall of Fame, namely Graeme Smith, Matthew Hayden, Hashim Amla, Daniel Vettori, MS Dhoni, Sarah Taylor and Sana Mir.

Australia's road to WTC Final: How Pat Cummins' side dominated in all conditionsAustralia take on South Africa in the World Test Championship final in Lord's. The defending champions have once again underlined their red-ball supremacy by reaching the final of the ICC World Test Championship 2023–25 cycle.

Watch: Rishabh Pant breaks stadium's roof with monstrous six during practiceIndia wicketkeeper batter Rishabh Pant damaged the stadium's roof during a practice session ahead of the five-match Test series against England set to begin from June 20.

While some impressed, others failed to make a mark as India get set for the first Test against England, starting on June 20.

MS Dhoni's priceless reaction after being inducted in ICC Hall of FameLegendary India captain MS Dhoni was inducted into the ICC Hall of Fame amongst six other players. Dhoni said that it was a huge honour to join a club full of legends, and he will cherish it forever.

Hayden, Graeme Smith, Hashim Amla among others inducted in ICC Hall of FameThe International Cricket Council (ICC) announced seven new inductees into the Hall of Fame, namely Graeme Smith, Matthew Hayden, Hashim Amla, Daniel Vettori, MS Dhoni, Sarah Taylor and Sana Mir.

Australia's road to WTC Final: How Pat Cummins' side dominated in all conditionsAustralia take on South Africa in the World Test Championship final in Lord's. The defending champions have once again underlined their red-ball supremacy by reaching the final of the ICC World Test Championship 2023–25 cycle.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
